scenes.title: Three-front war, one new lever
scenes.main_point: AI raised expectations, broke distribution, and intensified competition; growth shifted to trust.
scenes.scene_summary: AI raised expectations, collapsed channels, and attacked value props—so growth shifted to trust.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In a modern office war-room, a lone growth strategist stands at a whiteboard as three opposing forces—incumbent suits, scrappy startup founders, and demanding customers—press in from different sides.
Behind them, fading icons of broken distribution channels and swirling AI symbols raise the tension, while the strategist reaches toward a single clear lever labeled “Trust.”

scenes.title: Trust-based acquisition replaces broken channels
scenes.main_point: SEO, SEM, and corporate social weakened; trust-forward channels drove word of mouth.
scenes.scene_summary: SEO, SEM, and corporate social weakened; employees, creators, community, and product experience drove word of mouth.
key_elements: SEO disrupted by AI content and answer engines
SEM costs rising and ROAS falling
Word of mouth as ultimate trust signal
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In the same war-room map setting from scene 1, the same startup team turns away from fading signs labeled SEO, SEM, and Corporate Social.
They link hands with employees, creators, and a small community circle, passing a “trust” ribbon that becomes word-of-mouth arrows spreading outward, with a small “Cello” referral card on the table.

scenes.title: Trust-based retention becomes the moat
scenes.main_point: AI commoditized cheaper/faster value props; retention depended on confidence in ongoing outcomes.
scenes.scene_summary: AI commoditized cheaper and faster value; customers stayed with products that kept earning trust.
key_elements: Value prop triad: cheaper, more efficient, more effective
AI outcompeting efficiency and cost savings
Trust as confidence in future outcomes
Build in public via real people
Closing warning: channels collapsing faster than expected
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In the same war-room with the strategy board from earlier scenes, the same founder and cross-functional team (product, marketing, customer success) stand together, calmly placing a wide stone labeled “TRUST” as a moat around their product icon.
On the board, small notes read “transparent roadmap,” “fast feedback iterations,” “WOW UX,” “lifecycle comms,” and “outcome-aligned pricing,” while faded arrows labeled “cheaper” and “faster” wash away beyond the moat, implying steady confidence.
